keel.Algorithms.ImbalancedClassification.ImbalancedAlgorithms.GP_COACH_H

Class CHC

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.ImbalancedClassification.ImbalancedAlgorithms.GP_COACH_H.CHC

  • public class CHC
extends java.lang.Object

    Title: CHC

    Description: Uses a CHC algorithm to select the rules used in the GP-COACH-H algorithm

    Company: KEEL

    Since:
    JDK1.5
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Written by Victoria Lopez (University of Granada) 26/04/2011

    • Constructor Detail

      • CHC

        public CHC()
        Default constructor

      • CHC

        public CHC(myDataset current_dataset,
           GP_COACH_H gp_coach_data,
           double alpha,
           java.util.ArrayList<Rule> pop,
           int n_low,
           int n_high,
           int eval,
           int popLength,
           int bits_per_gene)
        Creates a CHC object with its parameters
        Parameters:
        current_dataset - Training dataset used in this algorithm
        gp_coach_data - GP-COACH-H object that we will use to train an element in the training set with our rules
        alpha - Alpha of the raw_fitness evaluation function
        pop - Population of rules we want to select
        n_low - Number of low granularity rules in the rule base
        n_high - Number of high granularity rules in the rule base
        eval - Maximum number of evaluations in the CHC algorithm
        popLength - Size of the population in the CHC algorithm
        bits_per_gene - Bits per gene for the gray code associated to the real part of the CHC algorithm (lateral tuning)

    • Method Detail

      • runCHC

        public void runCHC()
        Run the CHC algorithm for the data in this population

        public java.util.ArrayList<Rule> obtainNewRuleBase()
        Obtains the best set of rules from the genetic rule selection process
        Returns:
        best set of rules

      • obtainLateralTuning

        public double[] obtainLateralTuning()
        Obtains the best lateral tuning from the genetic tuning process
        Returns:
        real matrix representing the best lateral tuning that needs to be applied to the data base
